model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
How was your trip? Did your daughter like that place?
Yes she loved it!  It was a great weekend. Have you done much camping?
I have done a little camping and would like to do more in the future. What is one of your favorite places to camp?
I like Manitoba. Do you camp in a tent or Yurt, cabin or camper trailer?
I've only camped in a tent so far, but would like to try out a camper trailer. What do use for camping?
We usually do tents but we have camped in yurts too. Did you go to the zoo last weekend?
I see. Yes, I did make it to the zoo.  Have you gone to your local zoo?
I went to the Bronx zoo it was amazing! Did you get to see Joshua?
I think the Bronx Zoo is one of the best in the country.   Yes, I did see Joshua.  Did you use a season pass for the zoo or just a one time ticket?
One time. I was just there visititng family. What is your favorite zoo to visit?

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'visiting the zoo', 'Related Summaries': 'Discussion about visiting the zoo and recommendations for animal enclosures.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: That's good. You can take them to the zoo. I go there a lot to see animals. ### Speaker B: Which one? I just got to america and don't know any places. ### Speaker A: Most major cities have a good zoo and kids love them. I don't know all the names.' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'caring for pets', 'Related Summaries': 'Discussion on caring for pets and leaving them during camping trips.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: But you can't really leave her, right? My family like to go on camping adventures over the weekend, not sure how that'd work with a kitten at home. ### Speaker A: I may need to wait a few more months, but then I would not feel bad leaving her for a night or two. They do have kitty daycares too! ### Speaker B: THat's true. I'd feel a little bit bad about shipping her off somewhere for a night or two, I am sure she'd get confused.' }
```
